pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: awaiting-author

Thanks for the fast response, looks good to me.
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9183123548/job/25253239225)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9183123548/job/25253239758)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9183123548/job/25253238944)
Thanks for making these clean-ups. Looks good to me, modulo a few comments.
Thanks for making these clean-ups. Looks good to me, modulo a few comments.
Shouldn't this be `Set.preimage g {0}`?
Yes, but also this should be `Function.Exact`, and `Function.AddExact` doesn't exist (cc @AntoineChambert-Loir)
Similarly, `g` should be mentioned here.
Nice find. (At some point, I'd like to make the subgoal form of obtain warn in mathlib, at least to fix all such cases...)
If you want, you could also put the entire `def` on one line (it's 99 chars overall)
While you're at it, would you like to to switch to `refine`? Fine if not!
Also a nice find!
Just for my learning experience: this change is spelling out what was previously an implicit definitional equality?
Yeah, this left a goal `¬∑¬∑¬∑ œÉ‚Åª¬π ¬∑¬∑¬∑ ‚Üî ¬∑¬∑¬∑ Equiv.symm œÉ ¬∑¬∑¬∑` which is solved more cleanly with the lemma that seys those are equal.
The diff is hard to read - but this is just providing `b`, removing the now-superfluous last `infer_instance` and un-indenting, right?
Exactly, yeah. (Github has a :gear: icon at the top of the "Files changed" view that allows hiding whitespace changes)
Same questions here.

I don't object to these changes.

I'm not sure if doing them by hand is time-efficient, given that a Lean formatter doesn't seem to far away...
if you feel like shepherding more of these, I have a [branch](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/MR-formatting-nits) doing a few hundred of lines of such mathlib replacements - let me know if you're interested in reviewing such a PR. Otherwise, I'm happy to wait for a formatter instead.
I'm not holding my breath for a formatter :) I personally wouldn't mind landing automatic changes to this effect, but that would probably need some discussion on zulip first

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: tidy various files
